physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination revealed no gross abnormalities, except for abnormalities on fundoscopy consistent with macular degeneration. Mini-Mental State score was 27 out of 30, with errors in serial seven subtraction and short-term recall.
CT scan revealed diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon and atherosclerotic disease.
After medication adjustment, patient reported improvement in mood and resolution of pain complaints.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient experienced significant improvement but continued to display tearfulness, difficulty falling asleep, and persistent somatic delusions.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At psychiatric follow-up, Mini-Mental State score was 26 out of 30.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During subsequent visits, there were reports of increasing delusions regarding neighbors and a persistent belief of being followed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: During hospitalization, the patient was combative and agitated with unintelligible speech; lab evaluations were mostly negative, except for a urinary tract infection.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-hospitalization, there were ongoing concerns regarding delusions and the presence of a 'fine dust' in her apartment.
